        <educational>
          <learningResourceType>

            <value>lesson plan</value>
          </learningResourceType>
          <intendedEndUserRole>
            <source>LRE.intendedEndUserRoleValues</source>
            <value>teacher</value>
          </intendedEndUserRole>
          <typicalAgeRange>
            <string language="x-t-lre">14-14</string>
            <string language="en">14-14</string>
          </typicalAgeRange>
          <description>
            <string language="en">1. The aim of the lesson was to get the students acquainted with the linear function f(x)=ax+b and its plot. 

2. The students  worked in pairs using the worksheet prepared by the teacher and “WIRIS, your web calculator”, a mathematics online tool written in JAVA, which came from learning resources of Calibrate, downloaded from the page http://www.wiris.com/demo/en/
2. The students  made some plots using “WIRIS, your web calculator”. They  observed the plot of the function f(x)=ax+b and learned how it depends on coefficient “a” or “b”.
3. The students  saved plots which they made themselves as .jpg files and next they pasted them into their exercise-books (attachment).

3. In the end of the lesson students drew some plots themselves.
</string>
          </description>
        </educational>
